result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle A Odegard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost on Count 1 and on Count 2, for a total of $531.20 due to the Clerk of Court's Office. $10.00 per month payment plan to begin on 5/1/16 and on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay will be warrant.
$200.00 DNA surcharge on Count 1 to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office. This will be added to the $10.00 per month payment plan, beginning on 5/1/16.
Must undergo an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.
Must undergo a Mental Health assessment and comply with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
29 days credit= time served.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

All outstanding financial obligations are reduced to a civil judgment against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities, made payable to the Clerk of Court's Office and subject to tax intercept and all other collection efforts.
